greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where T(n,k) is Sum_{i=0..n} binomial(n,i)*Sum_{j=0..i} binomial(i,j)^k.
comment: T(n,k) is the constant term in the expansion of (1 + Product_{j=1..k-1} (1 + x_j) + Product_{j=1..k-1} (1 + 1/x_j))^n for k > 0.
For fixed k > 0 is T(n,k) ~ (2^k + 1)^(n + (k-1)/2) / (2^((k-1)^2/2) * sqrt(k) * (Pi*n)^((k-1)/2)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Oct 28 2019
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n, i] * Sum[Binomial[i, j]^k, {j, 0, i}], {i, 0, n}]; Table[T[k, n - k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, May 06 2021 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Oct 28 2019
